title: How to Fix There Was an Error Connecting to the Apple ID Server

steps.title: Make sure your Wi-Fi network is online.
steps.content: Make sure your Wi-Fi network is online. If you're having trouble connecting to Wi-Fi, make sure the network is stable and active. If it isn't, you may need to restart your router .

steps.title: Disable any active VPN services.
steps.content: Disable any active VPN services. A VPN can block the connection with Apple's servers. Turn it off before you try to connect to the server again.

steps.title: Turn off your device and turn it on again.
steps.content: Turn off your device and turn it on again. A quick restart can fix common issues, whether you're using an iPhone , iPad , or Mac. If you're using a Mac, make sure you select Shut Down rather than Restart .

steps.title: Log out and log in again.
steps.content: Log out and log in again. This can help sync new information to your device. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap your Apple ID. Scroll down and tap Sign out twice. Tap Sign in to your iPhone . Enter your Apple ID and password.

steps.title: Go to Apple's System Status checker.
steps.content: Go to Apple's System Status checker . If there are any issues regarding Apple's services, you'll see them here. If everything is working properly, you'll see a green circle next to "All services are operating normally".

steps.title: Make sure you're running the latest version.
steps.content: Make sure you're running the latest version. Keeping your device up-to-date can help you avoid software issues. On iOS, go to Settings → General → Software Update → Download and Install . On Mac, click the Apple menu. Click System Settings/Preferences → General → Software Update .

steps.title: Update the password for your Apple ID.
steps.content: Update the password for your Apple ID. If you recently updated your password on a different device, you'll need to enter it again on your current device. This also keeps your Apple ID secure. [1] X Research source To change your password , navigate to your device's settings and select Apple ID .

steps.title: Make sure your time zone is correct.
steps.content: Make sure your time zone is correct. When the time zone is set incorrectly, it may interfere with certain apps and features. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap General . Tap Date & Time . Toggle on Set Automatically .
